subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The VC-Founder Relationship: Marriage Without Romance
description: A micro-lesson that makes The VC-Founder Relationship: Marriage Without Romance usable.

hook.text: Choosing a VC is like choosing a spouse. You'll be together for 7-10 years with no easy divorce.

buildup.text: A good VC adds value beyond money: introductions, hiring help, strategic advice in crises.

discovery.text: A bad VC micromanages, pushes premature growth, or disappears when things get hard.

twist.text: Founders can reference-check VCs too. Call other portfolio founders and ask about the bad times.

climax.text: The best VC relationships are built on trust and honest disagreement, not cheerful agreements.

punchline.text: Choose an investor you'd want in the foxhole, not just at the party.

quiz.question: What's the best way for founders to evaluate potential VCs?
options: Reference-check them by talking to other founders in their portfolio
Choose the VC offering the highest valuation
Pick the VC with the most famous brand name
